You are given a list of numbers from 1 to $n$.  You repeatedly remove the $i$-th number from the list, where $i$ is the current step number. You stop when there are fewer than $i$ numbers left.  

Given a list length $n$ and a position $x$, find the value of the $x$-th remaining number after the algorithm stops. 

You will be given multiple test cases.

You have a list of numbers.  You repeatedly remove the current number from the list.  You stop when there are fewer numbers left than the current number you would remove. What is the value of the x-th remaining number?
